image.altText: Sam kerr looks downcast

items.synopsis: The Matildas miss their chance to make the Women's World Cup final, going down 3-1 to England in the semifinal at Stadium Australia.

title.children: 'Three sitters in a row': Matildas bemoan missed opportunities late in semifinal loss

image.altText: A Matildas soccer player rubs her face on her green and gold jersey as other plays look dejected.

items.synopsis: Having already recorded the best-ever result for an Australian soccer team in a World Cup, the Matildas will now vie for third place.

title.children: The Matildas didn't make it to the final, but they've got one more match to play this World Cup. Here's what happens now

image.altText: A man in a hair salon chair holds up dread locks that have been cut off.

items.synopsis: Christopher Mark Jordan makes another court appearance in Launceston, facing new charges over a cannabis plant and the storage of ammunition.

title.children: Shyanne-Lee Tatnell murder accused appears in court with more charges

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks with state and territory leaders in a conference room.

items.synopsis: The prime minister has touted a "better deal for renters" and a blueprint to boost housing supply following a meeting with state and territory leaders in Brisbane this afternoon.

title.children: National cabinet touts 'better deal for renters' but Greens slam moves as 'smoke and mirrors'

image.altText: A woman in a yellow football shirt looks to kick a ball very hard.

items.synopsis: The Matildas have gone from strength to strength in the FIFA Women's World Cup. With more players joining Sam Kerr as household names, here's your pocket guide to the entire Matildas squad.

title.children: As Mary Fowler and Caitlin Foord become household names, here's your pocket guide to the Matildas

image.altText: Alana Young addresses the crowd through tears on Russell Island

items.synopsis: Five boys and their father were killed in the blaze, the state's worst house fire tragedy since 2011. Today, loved ones paid tribute to the "heroic" dad and his "beautiful" boys.

title.children: 'Real heartbreak is outliving children': Loved ones gather to mourn loss of five boys, father on Russell Island

image.altText: A toddle sticking out their red toungue.

items.synopsis: Queenslanders are being warned to be vigilant for fever and rash symptoms in young children as group A streptococcus infections sweep across the state.

title.children: Parents urged to watch for scarlet fever symptoms as strep A cases surge in Queensland

image.altText: A football player at a media conference.

items.synopsis: Adelaide Crows midfielder Paul Seedsman becomes the latest AFL player to retire due to ongoing concussion issues, saying he has been advised to "cease all contact sport".

title.children: Concussion causes another AFL retirement, with Paul Seedsman to try migraine injections

image.altText: Bright red dome sits in snowy Antarctic landscape

items.synopsis: Looking like citrus peel, sections of fibreglass are being manufactured and flat-packed on the outskirts of a rural Tasmanian town, destined for Antarctica or even Hollywood.

title.children: 'Apple huts' keep scientists warm in Antarctica — they come from a little town called Penguin

image.altText: A smiling man in a blue t-shirt.

items.synopsis: Shirley McPherson says while she does not have official confirmation of her father Alfie Rawlings's death, she has received information from relatives of other Maui residents whose lives were claimed by the inferno.

title.children: Missing father presumed to have died in Hawaii wildfires, Adelaide daughter says

image.altText: A man dribbles a basketball in front of his opponent.

items.synopsis: With the Basketball World Cup a little over a week away, the Boomers suffer a loss to Brazil in a warm-up match in Melbourne.

title.children: Boomers' World Cup preparations take a hit as Aussies lose to Brazil in warm-up clash

image.altText: A man on his phone in a yard.

items.synopsis: The financial complaints authority appears to have made inconsistent rulings on whether to give customers refunds after phishing scams, based on whether customers admit to clicking dodgy links.

title.children: Roger knew something was wrong when he checked his bank app and saw 11 new payees

image.altText: Stack of several thousand dollars worth of Australian $50 notes showing David Unaipon

items.synopsis: A survey of insolvency professionals, turnaround advisors, company boards and lawyers says sentiment among working professionals has fallen noticeably during a relatively short space of time.

title.children: Australian recession 'likely' in the next 12 months, according to new industry survey

image.altText: NSW Transport Minister Jo Haylen speaking at a press conference, with NSW Premier Chris Minns standing in the background.

items.synopsis: Josh Murray was hired to a $600k-a-year role despite an external recruiter finding he was under-qualified.

title.children: 'Jobs for the boys': Transport minister under fire over controversial $600k hire

image.altText: An older man wearing a singlet and sunglasses takes a selfie at a beach.

items.synopsis: Newcastle District Court heard that Colin William Babbage, 65, threatened a 31-year-old woman with a knife before he sexually assaulted her in 2021. She was his fourth victim.

title.children: Serial rapist who has served almost 20 years behind bars jailed again

image.altText: A green and pink parrot on a perch inside a home

items.synopsis: When Conor Mulligan's pet parrot went missing in suburban Adelaide, he did what many pet owners do and distributed posters around the area, but never imagined it would lead to "one of the scariest situations" he had ever been in.

title.children: Conor offered a reward for his missing bird. Days later he was being ambushed

image.altText: A young man stands on a fishing boat giving a thumbs up

items.synopsis: Four Australian surfers who went missing off the coast of Aceh are reunited to recover with their friends, while the search continues for the final missing Indonesian crew member, Fifan Satria.

title.children: 'We all pray to God he will be found': Search continues for Indonesian crew member as Australian surfers reunite

image.altText: A surfer catches a wave in a promotional image by Banyak Surf Resort.

items.synopsis: For decades, surfers have been taking risky trips to hard-to-reach places across Indonesia looking for the ideal wave.

title.children: Four Australians who went missing in Indonesian waters were going on a surfing trip. What's the lure of Aceh?

image.altText: A red Australia Post electric sign

items.synopsis: A WA man who sent 23 parcels of his own faeces and urine through Australia Post in "bizarre circumstances" is handed a two-year good behaviour bond.

title.children: Man who sent faeces in post addressed to Leonardo DiCaprio, Jared Leto escapes jail time

image.altText: Fire damage is shown in the Wahikuli Terrace neighborhood in the fire ravaged town of Lahaina

items.synopsis: The exact cause of the fire remains unknown, but some are pointing the finger at an electricity company for leaving its grid on amid high wind warnings and dozens of toppled poles.

title.children: Powerlines are being blamed for the Maui fires. If true, it's not without precedent

image.altText: A woman in front of the ACT court building.

items.synopsis: A 71-year-old woman who helped her son defraud the Department of Defence of close to $100,000 is fined $2,000.

title.children: Woman who helped son defraud federal government of $91,000 issued fine, given good behaviour order

image.altText: A young mum and a pixelated image of her daughter.

items.synopsis: Police launch a critical incident investigation into the circumstances surrounding mother-of-four Drew Douglas's death and why officers did not attend her address after a welfare call was made.

title.children: Man charged with murder after mother of four stabbed to death in Western Sydney

image.altText: A school building with a sign in front of the building reading St Patricks College

items.synopsis: The principal of a prestigious Victorian school has written to staff and parents amid investigations into the behaviour of a staff member and claims of toxic workplace culture.

title.children: Principal of top private boys' school rejects claims of 'workplace cultural issues'

image.altText: The very top/ back of a whale can be seen above the water of the ocean behind it islands sit in the distance.

items.synopsis: Boaties and fishers are being warned to stay clear of an injured humpback whale and its calf spotted off the coast of Townsville on Wednesday. Locals believe the whale may have been struck by a boat.

title.children: Concern for injured humpback whale and its calf spotted off Queensland coast

image.altText: A composite image of brothers Obaid and Shaheryer Khan, wearing suits outside court.

items.synopsis: Shaheryer and Obaid Khan are placed on a 12-month good behaviour bond after they were found in possession of 2.4 million counterfeit stamps when police raided their property in 2021.

title.children: Judge delivers good news for brothers caught up in multi-million-dollar postage stamp scam

image.altText: Business people walk past a shiny black sign that reads "Reserve Bank of Australia".

items.synopsis: Outgoing RBA governor Philip Lowe says Australia's economy has entered the "third phase" in its fight against high inflation. Here's what it means for interest rates and mortgages, and whether more rate rises are likely.

title.children: The RBA says the fight against inflation is in a new phase, but what does it mean for rising interest rates?

image.altText: A woman sits watching a speaker intently at a conference.

items.synopsis: An explosive memo written by Gina Rinehart, allegedly part of a "special project" to deflate the value of Hancock Prospecting shares, has been presented to the Supreme Court as part of a huge civil trial in Perth.

title.children: 'Egregious breach of duty': Gina Rinehart tried to deflate value of shares in family trust, court hears

image.altText: Elderly man sitting in an armchair holding a cheque book.

items.synopsis: It's been six months since the town of Carnamah in Western Australia lost its only bank. Locals have told a senate inquiry into bank closures how they're now travelling hours to access financial services.

title.children: Would you travel 240km for your banking? These regional Australians are being forced to do just that

image.altText: Many fire ants on a ten cent coin.

items.synopsis: The NSW government is warning those convicted of breaking biosecurity controls could face enormous fines as it ramps up efforts to keep dangerous fire ants out of the state.

title.children: Are you bringing a pot plant from Queensland to NSW? You could be risking a million-dollar fine

image.altText: A smiling middle-aged man with dark hair takes a selfie with a similing woman, dark blonde, red lipstick, black sleeveless top.

items.synopsis: The family of a woman who suffered a brain bleed after an accident in Thailand earlier this year has shared their grief at her death yesterday.

title.children: Woman succumbs to injuries after fall on Thailand holiday as family mourns 'kindest' person

image.altText: A lyrebird extends its feathers.

items.synopsis: Lyrebird calls echo through the forests of south-east Australia. But the passing of these songs from one generation to another is at risk.

title.children: 'This is how they learn': Rare footage captures a lyrebird singing lesson
